Reason: The 'commitlog_segment_size_in_mb' configuration is performance-sensitive. This is because the size of individual commitlog file segments directly impacts the granularity of archiving commitlog segments and the max mutation size, which are critical for system performance. The code uses this configuration to allocate buffer pools, map file segments, and calculate disk sizes, all of which are time-expensive and memory-expensive operations. Therefore, any changes in the 'commitlog_segment_size_in_mb' value can lead to notable performance variations at the system level, making it a performance-sensitive configuration.
